metadata.title: CVE-2018-20650 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A reachable Object::dictLookup assertion in Poppler 0.72.0 allows attackersto cause a denial of service due to the lack of a check for the dict datatype, as demonstrated by use of the FileSpec class (in FileSpec.cc) inpdfdetach.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.15
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.15
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.15
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.15
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.15
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.15
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.15').
